title: Energy Transfer and Conservation

vocab.definition: The ability to cause change or do work
Stored energy that has the potential to cause motion
When energy moves from one object to another
Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only changed from one form to another

teachingNotes: Use hands-on demonstrations with pendulums, rolling balls, and rubber bands to show energy transfer. Discuss how energy changes form but is never lost.

sample.question: What is the difference between kinetic and potential energy?
expectedAny: kinetic is moving, potential is stored
kinetic is motion, potential is position

truefalse.question: Energy can be created and destroyed.

multiplechoice.question: A ball sitting at the top of a hill has what type of energy?

fillintheblank.question: When a ball rolls down a hill, potential energy changes to ________ energy.

shortanswer.question: Give an example of energy transfer you see every day.
